info.name: Snapdocs Closings API - Public Collection
info.description:
This collection presents the basic client use cases of **Snapdocs's** Closings API.

Version 1.0

* * *

This collection works in conjunction with the Postman "Public Collection" environment to provide users a way to run simple end-to-end (ETE) closing workflows. The collection works by saving request responses into environment variables and using the variables in subsequent requests. For example, upon creating a closing, the new closing UUID will be saved and used to upload documents to that closing in a subsequent request.

Before using this collection, please do the following:

*   Download the collection and environment JSON files from .
*   Import both JSON files into your Postman workspace.
*   Navigate the left navigation menu to Environment => Public Collection and update the variables for your environment. Some default values have been provided for a basic demo. However, you may need to update some variables based on customer support's recommendations. The most important variables are:
    *   AuthBaseUrl - *URL for acquiring an authentication token*
    *   BaseUrl - *URL to access the Closings API*
    *   AdminClientId - *the preconfigured client ID for.authentication*
    *   AdminClientSecret - *the preconfigured client secret for authentication*
    *   company_id - *Snapdocs's assigned company ID for your organization*
*   Select the Public Collection environment.
    

Once the environment is set up for the Postman collection runner, you can -

*   Select the entire collection and click 'Run' to execute all the workflows contained. Or,
*   Run individual workflows by -
    *   Select the 'Auth => Regular Use' sub-folder and click 'Run' to obtain an authenticated client.
    *   Select any of the individual workflows and click 'Run'. For example, I can select the 'Closings => ETE Happy Path Wet Closing' sub-folder to tryout some common API requests leading from creating a wet closing to completing it.

* * *

For detailed descriptions of the API and user guides, please refer to [the API documentation](https://snapdocs-closings.readme.io/reference/intro).

Questions? Please contact [api@snapdocs.com](mailto:api@snapdocs.com)
